title: Trump Lectures South African President in Televised Oval Office Confrontation
snippets: President Trump showed a video and leafed through printouts of what he said was evidence of racial persecution of white South Africans. The country’s president tried to correct the record.

summary: President Trump presented a video and printed materials claiming to show racial persecution of white South Africans. In response, South Africa's president attempted to clarify the situation and correct any misconceptions presented by Trump.

However, it doesn't offer deep insights or actionable information for the reader. There's no clear progress or solution reported, and the understanding of the situation remains superficial.

title: Australia news live: Minns warns NSW to ‘brace for more tough news’ after body found in floods-hit home; Ley disputes McKenzie claim
snippets:
NSW premier apologises to flood-affected residents experiencing ‘anxious’ hours-long waits for rescue. Follow today’s news live

  • NSW floods map: record-breaking rain in charts and maps
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Minns says community ‘no doubt bracing’ for more bad news after flooding death

The NSW premier is “bracing for more tough news” following news of a death in the state’s inundated mid-north coast.

It’s devastating for that man and his family and his friends. [It’s] a tight-knit community on the mid-north coast, and to lose anyone in these natural disasters is obviously horrifying. So I’m very sorry for that man’s passing.

We should be bracing for more tough news over the next 24 hours. We’re very grateful we got enormous amount of expertise, emergency service personnel and thousands of volunteers who are on site, but when you have major natural disasters, obviously, you get terrible news as a result, and that community no doubt will be bracing in the next 24 hours.

I’m sorry about that. That would be incredibly anxious period, waiting that period of time for a rescue.

I can assure the public that we have got a massive emergency service contingent on the Mid North Coast. There’s 2,500 emergency service workers including 2,200 SES volunteers and professionals that are on site. Over 500 vehicles and boasts, 13 helicopters, hundreds of drones, so this is a major operation.

Continue reading...

summary: The NSW premier apologized to residents affected by record-breaking floods for the long waits for rescue, acknowledging the anxiety caused. Following a death on the state's mid-north coast, the premier braced the community for more potentially tough news. Over 2,500 emergency service workers, including 2,200 SES volunteers, are involved in the massive rescue operation, utilizing over 500 vehicles, 13 helicopters, and hundreds of drones. The efforts aim to manage the crisis and support the flood-hit areas.

title: Concerns grow over loss of major Vernon event, economic benefits
snippets: After 12 years, organizers of the Okanagan Military Tattoo have called it quits, pointing a lot of the blame at the city and its decision to jack up rents at city-owned facilities.
titles: Concerns grow over loss of major Vernon event, economic benefits
summary: After 12 years, the Okanagan Military Tattoo, an event showcasing military music and drills, has been canceled. The organizers have attributed the cancellation primarily to the city's decision to significantly increase rental fees for city-owned venues.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the cancellation of a major event due to increased rental fees. However, it does not delve into potential solutions or alternatives, nor does it provide a broader context about the economic impact or potential trends in event cancellations.

title: Trump’s meeting with tax bill holdouts ‘moved ball in right direction’, says White House – US politics live
snippets:
Trump spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt describes meeting as ‘productive’ as president tries to get ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ past objections

A federal judge has rejected a bid by the US treasury department to cancel a union contract covering tens of thousands of IRS staff, Reuters reports, in an early blow to Donald Trump’s efforts to eliminate collective bargaining rights for many federal workers.

US district judge Danny Reeves in Lexington, Kentucky, said in a written opinion late on Tuesday that the department lacked legal standing to bring a lawsuit against the National Treasury Employees Union (NTEU).

Continue reading...
titles: Trump’s meeting with tax bill holdouts ‘moved ball in right direction’, says White House – US politics live
summary: A federal judge, Danny Reeves, has denied the US Treasury Department's attempt to cancel a union contract for thousands of IRS employees, marking a setback for Donald Trump's efforts to remove collective bargaining rights from federal workers. The judge ruled that the department did not have the legal standing to sue the National Treasury Employees Union (NTEU). This decision comes as Trump seeks to pass significant legislation, referred to by his spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt as the 'Big Beautiful Bill.'
constructiveness_reason: The story informs about a significant legal decision protecting union rights, which can be seen as a progress. It also provides context about the ongoing political efforts to pass a major legislation. However, it could offer more depth on the implications of this decision for federal workers and the broader labor market.

title: Watch These Palo Alto Networks Stock Levels After Post-Earnings Slide
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Palo Alto Networks shares tumbled on Wednesday as the cybersecurity giant’s mostly in-line guidance overshadowed quarterly results that surpassed Wall Street expectations. 
  • The stock had trended modestly higher after breaking out above the upper trendline of a descending broadening formation in late April. More recently, the relative strength index had tracked toward overbought levels.
  • Investors should watch key support levels on Palo Alto's chart around $180 and $165, while also monitoring key resistance levels near $205 and $240.


Palo Alto Networks (PANW) shares tumbled on Wednesday as the cybersecurity giant’s mostly in-line guidance overshadowed quarterly results that surpassed Wall Street estimates, indicating investors may have been looking for more.

The stock fell nearly 7% to close at around $181, pushing it slightly into negative territory year-to-date. Shares are still up about 25% from last month's low, as investors continue to assess the company’s platformization strategy, which involves transitioning customers to a cloud-based cybersecurity platform.

 Below, we take a closer look at Palo Alto’s chart and use technical analysis to identify price levels worth watching out for.

Recent Breakout in Focus

Palo Alto shares had trended modestly higher after breaking out above the upper trendline of a descending broadening formation in late April.

More recently, the relative strength index tracked toward overbought levels, indicating building price momentum ahead of the cybersecurity giant’s quarterly results. That bullish sentiment ended abruptly on Wednesday.

Let’s identify several support and resistance levels on Palo Alto’s chart that investors will likely be watching.

Key Support Levels to Watch

The first lower level to watch sits around $180. This area, currently located roughly midway between the 50- and 200-day moving averages, may provide support near a trendline that connects a range of corresponding price action on the chart stretching back to last September.

Selling below this level raises the possibility for a steeper drop to the $165 level. Investors could seek longer-term buy-and-hold opportunities in this region near January’s retracement to the 200-day MA, which also closely aligns with troughs that formed on the chart during September and October last year.

Key Resistance Levels to Monitor

Upon a resumption of the stock’s recent move higher, it’s worth monitoring the $205 area. This area may provide overhead selling pressure near a series of peaks that developed on the chart between November and February.

Finally, investors can forecast a potential price target above the stock’s record high by using the measuring principle, a technique that analyzes chart patterns to project future price moves.

When applying the analysis to Palo Alto’s chart, we calculate the distance of the descending broadening formation from its low to high and add that amount to the pattern’s breakout point. For instance, we add $64 to $176, which projects a target of $240.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
titles: Watch These Palo Alto Networks Stock Levels After Post-Earnings Slide
summary: Palo Alto Networks' shares fell nearly 7% on Wednesday, closing around $181, despite quarterly results exceeding Wall Street expectations. The decline was attributed to the company's guidance, which was mostly in line with forecasts but apparently failed to impress investors. This drop slightly pushed the stock into negative territory for the year, although it remains 25% higher than last month's low. Technical analysis suggests watching for key support levels at $180 and $165, and resistance levels near $205 and $240, as investors evaluate the company's shift to a cloud-based cybersecurity pl
constructiveness_reason: This story offers actionable insights for investors by highlighting key support and resistance levels for Palo Alto Networks' stock. It also provides context for the stock's recent performance, contributing to a deeper understanding of the company's financial situation.

title: Intel’s Memory Leak Nightmare: 5,000 Bytes per Second in the Hands of Hackers
snippets: Computer scientists at ETH Zurich have uncovered a serious flaw in Intel processors that could let attackers steal sensitive information by exploiting how modern chips predict upcoming actions. Using specially designed sequences of instructions, hackers can bypass security boundaries and gradually read the entire memory of a shared processor. This vulnerability affects a wide range [...]
titles: Intel’s Memory Leak Nightmare: 5,000 Bytes per Second in the Hands of Hackers
summary: Researchers at ETH Zurich discovered a significant vulnerability in Intel processors, allowing hackers to steal sensitive data at a rate of 5,000 bytes per second. This flaw exploits the processors' predictive actions, enabling attackers to bypass security measures and access the entire memory of a shared processor. The issue poses a serious security risk across a broad range of Intel-powered devices.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a significant vulnerability in Intel processors, which could potentially impact a wide range of devices. However, it does not offer any solutions or improvements to the problem, nor does it empower the reader with actionable insights.

title: This Tiny Robot Can Jump 10 Feet High – Without Legs

titles: This Tiny Robot Can Jump 10 Feet High – Without Legs

constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights an innovation in robotics, providing the reader with a deeper understanding of the capabilities of modern technology. It also indirectly encourages further research and development in the field.

title: The Enhanced Games Has a Date, a Host City, and a Drug-Fueled World Record
snippets: The Enhanced Games, where athletes are allowed to take performance-enhancing drugs, will host its first event in May. One “enhanced” former Olympic swimmer has already broken the 50-meter freestyle record.
